page.title: Section 6 Livy: Hannibal Crosses The Alps

link.text: Hannibal crosses the Alps: Section VII

line.latin: elephanti sicut per artas vias magna mora agebantur, ita tutum ab hostibus quacumque incederent, quia insuetis aedeundi propius merus erat, agmen praebat. nono die in iugum Alpium perventum est...
line.english: The elepnats, although they were being lead through narrow paths with great delay, were keeping the column of march safe from the enemyies wherever they went because there was a fear of approaching near to them for those unused to them. On the ninth day they had reached the summit of the Alps.

point.text: They are huge animals on narrow paths (artas vias) which makes progress very slow. Also, the elephants are not in their natural terrain (flat, hot desert) and may be scared
The enemy (the Romans) are scared of elephants and are less likely to attack. The elephants are very strong and may be carrying men/baggage.
Instead of the perfect active "pervenerunt" often a Roman writer will use the impersonal perfect "the destination was reached [by them]". The effect of this is to sound more objective/detached

Time how long -> accusative (for x years); Time at which -> ablative (on x day). For 8 days the soldiers have been marching through this hostile terrain. They will be very tired and probably stressed from the hazards

line.latin: biduum in iugo stativa habita fessisque labore ac pugnando quies data militibus
line.english: They halted for two days on the summit and rest was given to the soldiers who were exhausted from their hard work from combat;

point.text: This is a gerund. A gerund is a verbal noun e.g. walk -> walking
Hannibal knows the limit of his men and shows good leadership by giving them proper break.
The verbal phrase meaning a "camp was set up"

line.latin: iumentaque aliquot, quae prolapsa in rupibus erant, sequendo vestigia agminis in castra pervenere
line.english: Some baggage animals which had fallen among the rocks, by following the column of march, arrived at camp.

point.text: All compounds of this verb are deponent. labor labi lapsus fall. Pro = forward
The Carthaginian soldiers would be very happy/relieved to see the animals finally arrive with their gear
This is another gerund. Livy seems to like them.
